Description: Fundamental scientific principles have been identified, but no practical applications have been identified yet.
The service concept is established, and initial feasibility studies have been conducted.
The service has been demonstrated in a laboratory setting, and initial experimental testing has been completed.
The service has been validated in a controlled environment and shown to work as intended.
The service has been validated in a Heritage Science environment and shown to work as intended. (For software this would count as an initial functioning version)
The service has been demonstrated in a Heritage Science environment and proven to be effective in meeting its objectives.
A functional prototype of the service has been demonstrated in an operational environment. (For software this would count as a close to fully functioning test version)

The service has been completed and qualified through test and demonstration, and is ready for production. (For software this would count as a version ready for release at the very final stages of testing)
The service has been successfully deployed and proven to be effective in a Heritage Science environment and has been exploited for successful Accesses.
